CO 2 Reduction Measurement.A closed, flat-bottomed quartz vessel was used as the reactor to conduct the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction experiments at room temperature.Typically, 50 mg of the as-obtained photocatalyst was ultrasonically suspended in an aqueous NaHCO 3 solution (0.1 M, 45 mL) with triethanolamine (5 mL) as the sacrificial agent.Then, a high-purity CO 2 gas (99.99) was continuously bubbled through the aqueous NaHCO 3 solution at a rate of 80 mL min -1 for 30 min to expel the dissolved oxygen
